intro: Neostenanthera gabonensis, commonly known as the Gabon sandalwood, is a flowering plant native to Central Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its woody stem and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are capsules that release seeds when mature. Neostenanthera gabonensis is valued for its aromatic wood, which has been traditionally used in indigenous crafts and rituals.
